title: Child shot self in NW Harris County
content:
More details have been released after a four-year-old boy shot himself early Tuesday morning at his grandparents' home in northwest Harris County.
The shooting happened about 12:15 a.m. in the 15400 block of Redbud Berry Way, according to the Harris County Sheriff's Office.
Deputies said when investigators were sent to the home they discovered the boy was wounded from a self-inflicted gunshot. He was breathing but unresponsive.
The boy, deputies said, was flown by LifeFlight medical helicopter to Memorial Hermann-The Texas Medical Center. He was in critical condition.
Deputies said the boy was staying with his grandparents when the shooting happened. The couple is cooperating with investigators. It is unclear how the child had access to the gun.
Deputies are investigating the case.
